Hierarch Kekropus:
When the gods laid the foundations of this world, they appointed the Giants -- strongest of all their creations -- to rule it as their stewards. Gradually, though, the Giants became disillusioned with their masters, until they could only see the gods' flaws and none of their virtues. The seeds of rebellion were born. Rationalizing that they had need to defend the themselves, the Giants created both the Kamael, including the three Spicula heroes, and mighty weapons capable of inflicting harm on the gods themselves. The Giants grew exceedingly powerful, and Einhasad became suspicious. She discovered their secre experiments and became wrathful. Unable to convince the other gods of the threat, she in her fury attacked the Giants alone. Taken by surprise, the Giants were thrown back. Finally, they committed the Kamael to the war, and the tide began to turn. The Spicula Harkilgamed used the legendary sword Enuma Elish to slay Einhasad's second daughter, while Katenar bombarded the goddess' army with the mighty cannon Leopold. The battle seemed to shift in favor of the Giants, who rejoiced at the might of their arms. Too soon, as it happened... Listen closely.
